summary: This is an internal staffing report for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York dated August 12, 2019. It details staffing levels, recruitment efforts, and daily absence data for Correctional Services staff for the period August 3-10, 2019. The document provides context about the facility's operational status around the time Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated there.

events.title: MCC New York Career Fair
events.description: MCC New York held a career fair at 290 Broadway with 174 potential applicants in attendance.

events.title: Correctional Services Absence Period Start
events.description: Start date of the documented 8-day period tracking staff absences at MCC New York.

events.title: Correctional Services Absence Period End
events.description: End date of the documented 8-day period tracking staff absences at MCC New York.

events.title: Scheduled Officer Start Date
events.description: Two additional correctional officers were scheduled to start work at MCC New York.

keyFacts: As of August 12, 2019, MCC New York had an overall staffing level of 84.86% and a Correctional Services staffing level of 83.70%.
The facility had 19 vacant officer positions and was actively recruiting using incentives, radio ads, newspaper ads, and career fairs.
Over an 8-day period (August 3-10, 2019), staff absences accounted for 177 Correctional Services posts not being filled.
The document shows the operational challenges and staffing pressures at the federal detention facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.
The report indicates ongoing recruitment efforts including a 10% relocation incentive and a 10% recruitment incentive approved since April 12, 2019.
